        Just in case someone doesn't have permission to view <span class="line"><!---->Just in case someone doesn't have permission to view <!----></span>crbug.com/1202613<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1202613" title="Security: Stack overflow in nested message loops"><!---->crbug.com/1202613<!----></a>.  I'm here to quote some of the content in it that may be helpful.<span class="line"><!---->.  I'm here to quote some of the content in it that may be helpful.<!----></span><br><br>>> Same as <span class="line"><!---->&gt;&gt; Same as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>, there are many other modules that could create nested message loops[1]. If we call those functions frequently to create nested message loops recursively, the stack will be pushed constantly, and eventually leading to the stack overflow as <span class="line"><!---->, there are many other modules that could create nested message loops[1]. If we call those functions frequently to create nested message loops recursively, the stack will be pushed constantly, and eventually leading to the stack overflow as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>. The details are as I said in <span class="line"><!---->.         Actually, same as <span class="line"><!---->Actually, same as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>, I think it's a memory corruption issue that could be exploited. The address it visits is not a null pointer or illegal address, but the space above the stack with an offset. If the attacker could allocate the space above the stack, he can do the stack pivot with controllable data.<span class="line"><!---->, I think it's a memory corruption issue that could be exploited. The address it visits is not a null pointer or illegal address, but the space above the stack with an offset. If the attacker could allocate the space above the stack, he can do the stack pivot with controllable data.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

      leecraso@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->leecraso@gmail.com<!----></span>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Another example of the bugs same as <span class="line"><!---->Another example of the bugs same as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a> and <span class="line"><!----> and <!----></span>crbug.com/1202613<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1202613" title="Security: Stack overflow in nested message loops"><!---->crbug.com/1202613<!----></a>. IPC-call |PrintingFailed|[1] could recursively create nested message loops[2]. Frequent calling of it will eventually lead to the stack overflow.<span class="line"><!---->. IPC-call |PrintingFailed|[1] could recursively create nested message loops[2]. Frequent calling of it will eventually lead to the stack overflow.<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:components/printing/common/print.mojom;l=361;drc=7f5777c93e60f6ea177b9ff69e4cd4e1d5d0af19<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:components/printing/common/print.mojom;l=361;drc=7f5777c93e60f6ea177b9ff69e4cd4e1d5d0af19"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:components/printing/common/print.mojom;l=361;drc=7f5777c93e60f6ea177b9ff69e4cd4e1d5d0af19<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/printing/print_error_dialog.cc;l=20;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=b2bbd48743b3df3de037c1633e7ca658f08e7469<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/printing/print_error_dialog.cc;l=20;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=b2bbd48743b3df3de037c1633e7ca658f08e7469"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/printing/print_error_dialog.cc;l=20;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=b2bbd48743b3df3de037c1633e7ca658f08e7469<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: All<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: All<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>1.  Apply the attached patch.diff to emulates a compromised renderer.<span class="line"><!---->1.  Apply the attached patch.diff to emulates a compromised renderer.<!----></span><br>2.	$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<span class="line"><!---->2.	$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<!----></span><br>	$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->	$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<!----></span><br>	$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->	$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br><br>Wait for around 30s, you will get a segmentation fault.<span class="line"><!---->Wait for around 30s, you will get a segmentation fault.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see attached debug_info file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see attached debug_info file<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Just in case someone doesn't have permission to view <span class="line"><!---->Just in case someone doesn't have permission to view <!----></span>crbug.com/1202613<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1202613" title="Security: Stack overflow in nested message loops"><!---->crbug.com/1202613<!----></a>.  I'm here to quote some of the content in it that may be helpful.<span class="line"><!---->.  I'm here to quote some of the content in it that may be helpful.<!----></span><br><br>>> Same as <span class="line"><!---->&gt;&gt; Same as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>, there are many other modules that could create nested message loops[1]. If we call those functions frequently to create nested message loops recursively, the stack will be pushed constantly, and eventually leading to the stack overflow as <span class="line"><!---->, there are many other modules that could create nested message loops[1]. If we call those functions frequently to create nested message loops recursively, the stack will be pushed constantly, and eventually leading to the stack overflow as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>.         Actually, same as <span class="line"><!---->Actually, same as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>, I think it's a memory corruption issue that could be exploited. The address it visits is not a null pointer or illegal address, but the space above the stack with an offset. If the attacker could allocate the space above the stack, he can do the stack pivot with controllable data.<span class="line"><!---->, I think it's a memory corruption issue that could be exploited. The address it visits is not a null pointer or illegal address, but the space above the stack with an offset. If the attacker could allocate the space above the stack, he can do the stack pivot with controllable data.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

Don't pass it to a<span class="line"><!---->printing in those classes in the browser process. Don't pass it to a<!----></span><br>renderer, get the value back, and then set it.<span class="line"><!---->renderer, get the value back, and then set it.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1202661<a         This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Issue 1202661: Security:  Stack overflow in printing
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1202661: Security:  Stack overflow in printing
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      leecraso@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2715333234" title="leecraso@gmail.com"><!---->leecraso@gmail.com<!----></a>
      leecraso@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->leecraso@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Another example of the bugs same as <span class="line"><!---->Another example of the bugs same as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a> and <span class="line"><!----> and <!----></span>crbug.com/1202613<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1202613" title="Security: Stack overflow in nested message loops"><!---->crbug.com/1202613<!----></a>. IPC-call |PrintingFailed|[1] could recursively create nested message loops[2]. Frequent calling of it will eventually lead to the stack overflow.<span class="line"><!---->. IPC-call |PrintingFailed|[1] could recursively create nested message loops[2]. Frequent calling of it will eventually lead to the stack overflow.<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:components/printing/common/print.mojom;l=361;drc=7f5777c93e60f6ea177b9ff69e4cd4e1d5d0af19<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:components/printing/common/print.mojom;l=361;drc=7f5777c93e60f6ea177b9ff69e4cd4e1d5d0af19"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:components/printing/common/print.mojom;l=361;drc=7f5777c93e60f6ea177b9ff69e4cd4e1d5d0af19<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/printing/print_error_dialog.cc;l=20;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=b2bbd48743b3df3de037c1633e7ca658f08e7469<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/printing/print_error_dialog.cc;l=20;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=b2bbd48743b3df3de037c1633e7ca658f08e7469"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/printing/print_error_dialog.cc;l=20;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=b2bbd48743b3df3de037c1633e7ca658f08e7469<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: All<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: All<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>1.  Apply the attached patch.diff to emulates a compromised renderer.<span class="line"><!---->1.  Apply the attached patch.diff to emulates a compromised renderer.<!----></span><br>2.	$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<span class="line"><!---->2.	$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<!----></span><br>	$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->	$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<!----></span><br>	$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->	$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br><br>Wait for around 30s, you will get a segmentation fault.<span class="line"><!---->Wait for around 30s, you will get a segmentation fault.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see attached debug_info file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see attached debug_info file<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Just in case someone doesn't have permission to view <span class="line"><!---->Just in case someone doesn't have permission to view <!----></span>crbug.com/1202613<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1202613" title="Security: Stack overflow in nested message loops"><!---->crbug.com/1202613<!----></a>.  I'm here to quote some of the content in it that may be helpful.<span class="line"><!---->.  I'm here to quote some of the content in it that may be helpful.<!----></span><br><br>>> Same as <span class="line"><!---->&gt;&gt; Same as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>, there are many other modules that could create nested message loops[1]. If we call those functions frequently to create nested message loops recursively, the stack will be pushed constantly, and eventually leading to the stack overflow as <span class="line"><!---->, there are many other modules that could create nested message loops[1]. If we call those functions frequently to create nested message loops recursively, the stack will be pushed constantly, and eventually leading to the stack overflow as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>.           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1202661#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

        Actually, same as <span class="line"><!---->Actually, same as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>, I think it's a memory corruption issue that could be exploited. The address it visits is not a null pointer or illegal address, but the space above the stack with an offset. If the attacker could allocate the space above the stack, he can do the stack pivot with controllable data.<span class="line"><!---->, I think it's a memory corruption issue that could be exploited. The address it visits is not a null pointer or illegal address, but the space above the stack with an offset. If the attacker could allocate the space above the stack, he can do the stack pivot with controllable data.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>

        This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

Don't pass it to a<span class="line"><!---->printing in those classes in the browser process. Don't pass it to a<!----></span><br>renderer, get the value back, and then set it.<span class="line"><!---->renderer, get the value back, and then set it.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>eead1ba5da342d167728bf9c3d2d156661e312a8<a class="undefined" target="_blank"           margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Another example of the bugs same as <span class="line"><!---->Another example of the bugs same as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a> and <span class="line"><!----> and <!----></span>crbug.com/1202613<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1202613" title="Security: Stack overflow in nested message loops"><!---->crbug.com/1202613<!----></a>. IPC-call |PrintingFailed|[1] could recursively create nested message loops[2]. Frequent calling of it will eventually lead to the stack overflow.<span class="line"><!---->. IPC-call |PrintingFailed|[1] could recursively create nested message loops[2]. Frequent calling of it will eventually lead to the stack overflow.<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:components/printing/common/print.mojom;l=361;drc=7f5777c93e60f6ea177b9ff69e4cd4e1d5d0af19<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:components/printing/common/print.mojom;l=361;drc=7f5777c93e60f6ea177b9ff69e4cd4e1d5d0af19"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:components/printing/common/print.mojom;l=361;drc=7f5777c93e60f6ea177b9ff69e4cd4e1d5d0af19<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/printing/print_error_dialog.cc;l=20;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=b2bbd48743b3df3de037c1633e7ca658f08e7469<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/printing/print_error_dialog.cc;l=20;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=b2bbd48743b3df3de037c1633e7ca658f08e7469"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/printing/print_error_dialog.cc;l=20;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=b2bbd48743b3df3de037c1633e7ca658f08e7469<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: All<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: All<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>1.  Apply the attached patch.diff to emulates a compromised renderer.<span class="line"><!---->1.  Apply the attached patch.diff to emulates a compromised renderer.<!----></span><br>2.	$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<span class="line"><!---->2.	$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<!----></span><br>	$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->	$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<!----></span><br>	$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->	$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br><br>Wait for around 30s, you will get a segmentation fault.<span class="line"><!---->Wait for around 30s, you will get a segmentation fault.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see attached debug_info file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see attached debug_info file<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1202661#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Apr 26, 2021, 11:21 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1202661#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Apr 26, 2021, 11:21 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Just in case someone doesn't have permission to view <span class="line"><!---->Just in case someone doesn't have permission to view <!----></span>crbug.com/1202613<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1202613" title="Security: Stack overflow in nested message loops"><!---->crbug.com/1202613<!----></a>.  I'm here to quote some of the content in it that may be helpful.<span class="line"><!---->.  I'm here to quote some of the content in it that may be helpful.<!----></span><br><br>>> Same as <span class="line"><!---->&gt;&gt; Same as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>, there are many other modules that could create nested message loops[1]. If we call those functions frequently to create nested message loops recursively, the stack will be pushed constantly, and eventually leading to the stack overflow as <span class="line"><!---->, there are many other modules that could create nested message loops[1]. If we call those functions frequently to create nested message loops recursively, the stack will be pushed constantly, and eventually leading to the stack overflow as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>. The details are as I said in <span class="line"><!---->. The details are as I said in <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143#c70<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143#c70" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143#c70<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>      [1]. <span class="line"><!---->      [1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:base/run_loop.cc;l=111;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=e125e8d6661068afe340b0fd2c09d49f74ffe48b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:base/run_loop.cc;l=111;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=e125e8d6661068afe340b0fd2c09d49f74ffe48b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:base/run_loop.cc;l=111;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=e125e8d6661068afe340b0fd2c09d49f74ffe48b<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>

        Actually, same as <span class="line"><!---->Actually, same as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>, I think it's a memory corruption issue that could be exploited. The address it visits is not a null pointer or illegal address, but the space above the stack with an offset. If the attacker could allocate the space above the stack, he can do the stack pivot with controllable data.<span class="line"><!---->, I think it's a memory corruption issue that could be exploited. The address it visits is not a null pointer or illegal address, but the space above the stack with an offset. If the attacker could allocate the space above the stack, he can do the stack pivot with controllable data.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks.       VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Another example of the bugs same as <span class="line"><!---->Another example of the bugs same as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a> and <span class="line"><!----> and <!----></span>crbug.com/1202613<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1202613" title="Security: Stack overflow in nested message loops"><!---->crbug.com/1202613<!----></a>. IPC-call |PrintingFailed|[1] could recursively create nested message loops[2]. Frequent calling of it will eventually lead to the stack overflow.<span class="line"><!---->. IPC-call |PrintingFailed|[1] could recursively create nested message loops[2]. Frequent calling of it will eventually lead to the stack overflow.<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:components/printing/common/print.mojom;l=361;drc=7f5777c93e60f6ea177b9ff69e4cd4e1d5d0af19<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:components/printing/common/print.mojom;l=361;drc=7f5777c93e60f6ea177b9ff69e4cd4e1d5d0af19"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:components/printing/common/print.mojom;l=361;drc=7f5777c93e60f6ea177b9ff69e4cd4e1d5d0af19<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/printing/print_error_dialog.cc;l=20;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=b2bbd48743b3df3de037c1633e7ca658f08e7469<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/printing/print_error_dialog.cc;l=20;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=b2bbd48743b3df3de037c1633e7ca658f08e7469"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/printing/print_error_dialog.cc;l=20;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=b2bbd48743b3df3de037c1633e7ca658f08e7469<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: All<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: All<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>1.  Apply the attached patch.diff to emulates a compromised renderer.<span class="line"><!---->1.  Apply the attached patch.diff to emulates a compromised renderer.<!----></span><br>2.	$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<span class="line"><!---->2.	$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<!----></span><br>	$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->	$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<!----></span><br>	$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->	$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br><br>Wait for around 30s, you will get a segmentation fault.<span class="line"><!---->Wait for around 30s, you will get a segmentation fault.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see attached debug_info file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see attached debug_info file<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        To be clear, which process will suffer from stack overflow? The browser process or a renderer?<span class="line"><!---->To be clear, which process will suffer from stack overflow? The browser process or a renderer?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Just in case someone doesn't have permission to view <span class="line"><!---->Just in case someone doesn't have permission to view <!----></span>crbug.com/1202613<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1202613" title="Security: Stack overflow in nested message loops"><!---->crbug.com/1202613<!----></a>.  I'm here to quote some of the content in it that may be helpful.<span class="line"><!---->.  I'm here to quote some of the content in it that may be helpful.<!----></span><br><br>>> Same as <span class="line"><!---->&gt;&gt; Same as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>, there are many other modules that could create nested message loops[1]. If we call those functions frequently to create nested message loops recursively, the stack will be pushed constantly, and eventually leading to the stack overflow as <span class="line"><!---->, there are many other modules that could create nested message loops[1]. If we call those functions frequently to create nested message loops recursively, the stack will be pushed constantly, and eventually leading to the stack overflow as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>. The details are as I said in <span class="line"><!---->.         Actually, same as <span class="line"><!---->Actually, same as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>, I think it's a memory corruption issue that could be exploited. The address it visits is not a null pointer or illegal address, but the space above the stack with an offset. If the attacker could allocate the space above the stack, he can do the stack pivot with controllable data.<span class="line"><!---->, I think it's a memory corruption issue that could be exploited. The address it visits is not a null pointer or illegal address, but the space above the stack with an offset. If the attacker could allocate the space above the stack, he can do the stack pivot with controllable data.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Don't pass it to a<span class="line"><!---->printing in those classes in the browser process. Don't pass it to a<!----></span><br>renderer, get the value back, and then set it.<span class="line"><!---->renderer, get the value back, and then set it.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>eead1ba5da342d167728bf9c3d2d156661e312a8<a class="undefined" target="_blank"       VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Another example of the bugs same as <span class="line"><!---->Another example of the bugs same as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a> and <span class="line"><!----> and <!----></span>crbug.com/1202613<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1202613" title="Security: Stack overflow in nested message loops"><!---->crbug.com/1202613<!----></a>. IPC-call |PrintingFailed|[1] could recursively create nested message loops[2]. Frequent calling of it will eventually lead to the stack overflow.<span class="line"><!---->. IPC-call |PrintingFailed|[1] could recursively create nested message loops[2]. Frequent calling of it will eventually lead to the stack overflow.<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:components/printing/common/print.mojom;l=361;drc=7f5777c93e60f6ea177b9ff69e4cd4e1d5d0af19<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:components/printing/common/print.mojom;l=361;drc=7f5777c93e60f6ea177b9ff69e4cd4e1d5d0af19"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:components/printing/common/print.mojom;l=361;drc=7f5777c93e60f6ea177b9ff69e4cd4e1d5d0af19<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/printing/print_error_dialog.cc;l=20;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=b2bbd48743b3df3de037c1633e7ca658f08e7469<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/printing/print_error_dialog.cc;l=20;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=b2bbd48743b3df3de037c1633e7ca658f08e7469"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/printing/print_error_dialog.cc;l=20;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=b2bbd48743b3df3de037c1633e7ca658f08e7469<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: All<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: All<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>1.  Apply the attached patch.diff to emulates a compromised renderer.<span class="line"><!---->1.  Apply the attached patch.diff to emulates a compromised renderer.<!----></span><br>2.	$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<span class="line"><!---->2.	$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<!----></span><br>	$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->	$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<!----></span><br>	$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->	$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br><br>Wait for around 30s, you will get a segmentation fault.<span class="line"><!---->Wait for around 30s, you will get a segmentation fault.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see attached debug_info file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see attached debug_info file<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Just in case someone doesn't have permission to view <span class="line"><!---->Just in case someone doesn't have permission to view <!----></span>crbug.com/1202613<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1202613" title="Security: Stack overflow in nested message loops"><!---->crbug.com/1202613<!----></a>.  I'm here to quote some of the content in it that may be helpful.<span class="line"><!---->.  I'm here to quote some of the content in it that may be helpful.<!----></span><br><br>>> Same as <span class="line"><!---->&gt;&gt; Same as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>, there are many other modules that could create nested message loops[1]. If we call those functions frequently to create nested message loops recursively, the stack will be pushed constantly, and eventually leading to the stack overflow as <span class="line"><!---->, there are many other modules that could create nested message loops[1]. If we call those functions frequently to create nested message loops recursively, the stack will be pushed constantly, and eventually leading to the stack overflow as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>.           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1202661#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by

        Actually, same as <span class="line"><!---->Actually, same as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>, I think it's a memory corruption issue that could be exploited. The address it visits is not a null pointer or illegal address, but the space above the stack with an offset. If the attacker could allocate the space above the stack, he can do the stack pivot with controllable data.<span class="line"><!---->, I think it's a memory corruption issue that could be exploited. The address it visits is not a null pointer or illegal address, but the space above the stack with an offset. If the attacker could allocate the space above the stack, he can do the stack pivot with controllable data.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>

        This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4.           -reward-topanel reward-unpaid reward-10000
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/21c0a3d2f45de0c1eadef657749323f02c8e9799<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/21c0a3d2f45de0c1eadef657749323f02c8e9799"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/21c0a3d2f45de0c1eadef657749323f02c8e9799<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>21c0a3d2f45de0c1eadef657749323f02c8e9799<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/21c0a3d2f45de0c1eadef657749323f02c8e9799"><!---->21c0a3d2f45de0c1eadef657749323f02c8e9799<!----></a><br>Author: Lei Zhang <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Lei Zhang &lt;<!----></span>thestig@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/thestig@chromium.org"><!---->thestig@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Jun 04 19:07:32 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Jun 04 19:07:32 2021<!----></span><br><br>M92: Remove PrintManagerHost::DidGetDocumentCookie() interface.<span class="line"><!---->M92: Remove PrintManagerHost::DidGetDocumentCookie() interface.<!----></span><br><br>In PrintManager and derived classes, set the document cookie used for<span class="line"><!---->In PrintManager and derived classes, set the document cookie used for<!----></span><br>printing in those classes in the browser process. Don't pass it to a<span class="line"><!---->printing in those classes in the browser process. Don't pass it to a<!----></span><br>renderer, get the value back, and then set it.<span class="line"><!---->renderer, get the value back, and then set it.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>eead1ba5da342d167728bf9c3d2d156661e312a8<a class="undefined" target="_blank"            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      </label>

window.prpcClient = new AutoRefreshPrpcClient(
 CS_env.token, CS_env.tokenExpiresSec);

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
